input_text:
Job Title: Lead Mechanical Design Engineer

Location: Phoenix, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges

The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.

Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

Be responsible for providing technical expertise as a program team leader in the identification and development of new products. You will lead the design effort and be technically responsible for the project. You will provide reports to internal and customer senior stakeholders. You will lead proposals to address future business opportunities, value engineering, and program/process changes. Act as a key focal point for driving and implementing goals and objectives and are recognized by business management as a primary technical authority

Key Responsibilities

Act as Technical Lead for the mechanical design of electric motors, generators, and gearboxesMentoring and guiding designers on multiple different platforms to solve complex design problems.Act as a System Integration Design Lead to coordinate the efforts of a large group of designers, including module leads, during the development phase of a gas turbine engine.Drive schedule, BOM management, layout, design sprints, and module design coordination.Imagine, design, and develop products and systems as part of a highly engaged and integrated engineering team.You will collaborate across Honeywell Aerospace engineering teams to create solutions and systems that meet the evolving needs of our customers.You will participate in all phases of product development and will be a coach and mentor to less experienced engineers.Refine your engineering talents in a team-based culture by working with innovative products and technologies.Leading design teams that develop modern solutions to complex problems.Design engineering using CAD-based modeling.CAD-based draftingEngineering analysis and weight optimizationDesign for Manufacturing and cost estimation.Product presentationVoice of Customer

U.s. Citizen Requirements

Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.

YOU MUST HAVE

Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline such as sciences, technology, engineering, or mathematics15+ years of mechanical design engineering experience10+ years of experience in mechanical design with NX design tool including modeling and draftingPrior experience as a systems design leadMust be a US Citizen due to ITAR restrictions

WE VALUE

Bachelor’s degree in mechanical or aerospace engineeringExperience in high-speed rotating equipment design including electric motors, generators, turbomachinery, gear trains, and mechanical systems.Proven application of ASME Y14.5 drawing standards including geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T)Experience in Conceptual Design, Preliminary Design and Detailed Design phases.Ability to convey subtle or complex messages clearly, as appropriate for the topic and audience.Individuals who are self-motivated and able to work with little supervision, who consistently take the initiative to get things done, do things before being asked by others or forced to by events.Ability to consistently make timely decisions even in the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness.Demonstrated leadership experience in coordinating and overseeing successful projects.

Benefits Of Working For Honeywell

Benefits – Medical, Vision, Dental, Mental HealthPaid Vacation401k Plan/Retirement Benefits (as per regional policy)Career GrowthProfessional Development

About Honeywell

Honeywell International Inc. (NYSE: HON) invents and commercializes technologies that address some of the world’s most critical challenges around energy, safety, security, air travel, productivity, and global urbanization. We are a leading software-industrial company committed to introducing state-of-the-art technology solutions to improve efficiency, productivity, sustainability, and safety in high-growth businesses in broad-based, attractive industrial end markets. Our products and solutions enable a safer, more comfortable, and more productive world, enhancing the quality of life of people around the globe. Learn more about Honeywell: click here

THE BUSINESS UNIT

At Honeywell Aerospace, we are dedicated to developing innovative solutions for the aviation industry. Our team of experts works tirelessly to enhance the safety, efficiency, and performance of aerospace systems. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the advancement of aerospace technology and make a significant impact on the industry.

Additional Information

JOB ID: HRD227427Category: EngineeringLocation: 111 S 34th St.,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United StatesExemptMust be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.

Global (ALL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
